column1: # The location is stated as being in the centre of the town, but a precise location is not known. The grid reference is in the vicinity of the cathedral.
# Observer Rev. Francis Smith moved to Moville, Donegal in 1869 and continued observations there.
# These readings, and those from Moville, are duplicated on rainfall sheets labelled as 'Stratford on Avon', also attributed to Rev. Smith.
# British Rainfall almanacs for the period attribute the readings to Rev. Smith at Londonderry/Moville, with nothing to match at Stratford on Avon.
# Rev. Smith was in the Londonderry/Moville area at this time, so the 'Stratford on Avon' rainfall sheets should almost certainly be disregarded.
